info.game_comments:
1998 Teen Reunion Tournament final.
From the Wang Center for the Performing Arts in Boston, Massachusetts.

(1, 1).clue: Centuries before Columbus, these people encountered Native Americans & called them skraelings

(2, 1).clue: It was his portrayal of the mummy that was used on the U.S. stamp seen here

(3, 1).clue: Usually you begin this game by asking, "Animal, vegetable, or mineral?"

(4, 1).clue: "I never doubted myself", the Chicago Bulls star said after his title-winning jump shot in 1998

(5, 1).clue: Thick fur and a layer of blubber keep this northernmost species warm

(6, 1).clue: Stocks not listed on exchanges are said to be sold this way, like nonprescription drugs

(1, 2).clue: Around 9000 B.C., herds of these large wild cattle dramatically increased & became a major food source

(2, 2).clue: "The Curse of the Mummy's Tomb" is a top-seller in this kids' book series

(3, 2).clue: At arrival or departure, this "salute" is fired for a U.S. president or a visiting head of state

(4, 2).clue: In 1991 Scottie Pippen's defense on Magic Johnson helped the Bulls beat this team for their first title

(5, 2).clue: Bears' dormancy in this season isn't true hibernation, as their body temperature doesn't drop

(6, 2).clue: These open-end investment "funds"  began in the U.S. in the 1920s & now hold over $5 trillion

(1, 3).clue: The name of this light axe used as both weapon & tool comes from the proto-Algonquin for "to cut off"

(2, 3).clue: Ancient Egyptians worshipped these animals and now their "scans" are used to study mummies

(3, 3).clue: It's the numerical designation for normal visual acuity

(4, 3).clue: This colorful rebounding champ was an airport janitor when he began playing organized basketball

(5, 3).clue: The sloth bear is also called this "bear" after the food it & Pooh both crave

(6, 3).clue: Known as S&P, it tracks the market with reports, guides, and indices

(1, 4).clue: In the 1100s the Awatovi Pueblos near what is now Tuba City in this state housed 1,000 people in 1,300 rooms

(2, 4).clue: In the movies, 9 tana leaves have the power to do this
(2, 4).correct response: resurrect the dead (bring a mummy back to life)

(3, 4).clue: To the closest mile, it's the length of an Olympic marathon

(4, 4).clue: John Paxson clinched the title for the Bulls in 1993 with one of these shots instituted in the 1979-'80 season

(5, 4).clue: The "clan of" this animal, ursus speleaus, became extinct about 10,000 years ago

(6, 4).clue: This printing terms refers to funds deposited with a broker to protect the broker against loss

(1, 5).clue: The Mohawk, Oneida, Onondaga, Cayuga, and Seneca tribes made up this "league" founded around 1450

(2, 5).clue: In 1994 the Royal Mummy Room in this city's Egyptian Museum was reopened after 13 years

(3, 5).clue: As Captain Kirk could tell you, the original "Star Trek" TV series was set in this century

(4, 5).clue: Artis Gilmore, a star at this position, twice started the All-Star game against Kareem

(5, 5).clue: This species is named for its distinctive markings

(6, 5).clue: Short for "long-term equity anticipation securities", or what distraught investors took in the 1929 crash

(2, 1).clue: Zane Grey's ancestor Betty Zane helped save Fort Henry, now the site of this state's city of Wheeling

(3, 1).clue: In this film Debra Winger gets to have a fling with John Lithgow before she dies

(5, 1).clue: "So rested he by the tumtum tree, and stood awhile in thought" is a line from his "Jabberwocky"

(6, 1).clue: In 1999 this will resume its rightful position as 9th planet from the sun

(2, 2).clue: Its state fair is held in Columbia

(3, 2).clue: Stephen Hopkins, more recently "Lost in Space", directed the fifth installment of this Freddy Krueger series

(4, 2).clue: This measure is used for radioactive decay because the time for all atoms to break down is unknowable

(5, 2).clue: He wrote "Tree at My Window" a few years after "Stopping by Woods on a Snowy Evening"

(1, 3).clue: (Hey, what's happening?  I'm Mark McGrath of Sugar Ray.  The answer is…)  While touring in 1996, we played with Johnny Rotten & this group who had reunited

(3, 3).clue: In a 1985 spy movie, Timothy Hutton was "The Falcon" & Sean Penn was this cohort

(4, 3).clue: It's the study of the nature & behavior of light, & also the title of an Isaac Newton treatise

(1, 4).clue: Frank Sinatra brokered the reconciliation of these 2 on the 1976 Muscular Dystrophy Telethon
